title: Disney's Lion King remake casts Simba and Mufasa - and it's a Star Wars reunion
text:
Simba and Mufasa have been cast Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Disney's Lion King remake has its Simba as Donald Glover is cast in the role - and there's even better news as James Earl Jones is returning as Mufasa. 
Filmmaker Jon Favreau broke the news that Donald Glover will be playing Simba in the remake of the Disney classic on Twitter. Soon after, Favreau also announced that James Earl Jones will be reprising his role as Mufasa. 
Jones voiced the role in the original 1994 classic animation. Jonathan Taylor Thomas voiced young Simba, while Matthew Broderick voiced the adult version in the original. 
Glover is currently filming the young Han Solo spinoff movie in which he stars as Lando Calrissian. Jones is also known for his Star Wars work, where he voiced Darth Vader. Read More Disney's The Lion King remake UK release date, cast and latest news 
Favreau and Glover met at The Hollywood Reporter's conversation in creativity in December, where Favreau told him his son was a big fan of his music, which he performs under the name Childish Gambino. 
The director was behind Disney's remake of The Jungle Book last year. He's joined by Jeff Nathanson, who will write the script.
